results.title: The Great War
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War Experience”.
Uses contemporary film records of the Australian forces in the 1914-18 War to illustrate the conditions in which they served and the effects on survivors.

results.title: The Great Waltz
results.creator_credit: Julien Duvivier, Bernard H. Hyman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This film captures the spirit of a romantic age when Johann Strauss created some of the world’s favourite melodies. French actor Fernand Gravet plays Strauss with Luise Rainer as his wife Poldi. Soprano Miliza Korjus plays Carla Donner, the opera singer with whom Strauss was infatuated and for whom he wrote some of his greatest works including “Die Fledermaus”

results.title: The Great treasure house
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
Covers the theme of medicine in China. Shows traditional medicine, including acupuncture and herbalism. Since the Cultural Revolution many remarkable new applications for the ancient art of acupuncture have been discovered, and some of these are shown. We also see ‘barefoot doctors’, trained in simple medicine, working in minor illnesses in small villages. With the help of modern techniques being developed, alongside ancient and traditional medicine, the Chinese are among the healthiest people in the world today.

results.title: The Great Train Robbery
results.brief_description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. Of over 250 films created by Porter, his most important include Jack and the Beanstalk (1902), Life of an American Fireman (1903), The Great Train Robbery (1903), The Kleptomaniac (1905), Life of a Cowboy (1906), Rescued from an Eagle’s Nest (1908), and The Prisoner of Zenda (1913) .
results.description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. results.title: The Great toy robbery
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Hale, Tom Daly, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An animated spoof of the wild west movies starring the world’s most wanted good guy, Santa Claus, and three hard riding, gun-toting, bad guys. As in all formula westerns, good guys win over evil, but not before robbers and robbed have romped through some incongruous, though recognizable situations. (Awards include: New York, Belgrade)

results.title: The Great step forward: China women in the 20th century. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Qi Kejun, Xue Song, Liu Chun, Lin Xiezhong, Wei Bin, Yu Bo, Zhao Shujing, Chen Meng, Yuan Zhengming, ABC-TV (Australia), Southern Star Entertainment and CCTV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Dragon stirs”.
Final two parts of a four-part series about China. China, known as the Middle Kingdom between heaven and hell, has a long history of patriarchy and an unquestioning obedience by women to their family and feudal overlords. However, with the coming of the new millennium a law was passed allowing China’s women the same social and political rights as men. This is a historical presentation of women and their role in China, politically, socially, and philosophically during the 20th century looking at the traditions, culture and customs which held China’s women back for so long in their fight for equality with their male counterparts. Issues covered include arranged marriages, the binding of women’s feet, outside influences, Chinese reformists and feminists, the women’s movement, Mao Tse Dong and the Peoples Liberation Army, communism, Cultural Revolution of the 60s, sexuality in the 70s, free market and consumerism in the 80s and 90s. Features personal stories from women of all ages and varying backgrounds, archival footage including b&w images, excerpts from motion pictures made in China and profiles of those who played an influential role in the advancement of women’s rights in China. Narrated by Peter George and Diana McLean. In Mandarin with English subtitles and commentary in English.

results.title: The Great St Trinian's train robbery
results.creator_credit: Sidney Gilliat, Frank Launder, Leslie Gilliat, British Lion and Braywild
results.brief_description: The monstrous St Trinian’s schoolgirls with their headmistress, Amber Spottiswood, are on the move again. This time to Hamingwell Grange. But the Great Train Robbers have got there before them - and left two and half million pounds hidden under the stage. Desperate to retrieve their loot the train robbers pose as caterers at the school Parents’ Day, but they have not reckoned with the ferocity of the unbeatable girls of St Trinian’s! Cast includes Frankie Howerd, Dora Bryan, George Cole, Reg Varney, Raymond Huntley, Richard Wattis. Inspired by the drawings of Ronald Searle.

results.title: The Great snowball war
results.creator_credit: Andre Melancon, Nicole Robert, Rock Demers and Les Productions La Fete
results.brief_description: When children need to settle an argument it seems they devise inventive ways of resolving the issue. Take the two groups of children in this film, they resort to a snowball war! They are not restricted by their environment in the use of weapons either, as they grab wooden spoons, garbage lids and anything else at hand. It’s a fiercely contested battle as one group of kids takes cover in an enormous snowcastle while the opposition tries to break in. Who will win the war? Original screenplay by Danele Pantenaude and Roger Cantin.

results.title: The Great Sea Explorer
results.brief_description:
The story of Matthew Flinders and his journey to Australia. After leaving his family in England, Flinders sets off to sea, and after many years travelling to and around Australia, he returns home. His heroic journey is rewarded by the Queen with a house as a gift for his exploration achievements.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
